718189f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - [View in the park showing the roof of Arsenal Building.]
718189f-a.text:
Central Park: A view in the park near 65th Street, and showing the roof
of the Arsenal, thru the trees.
May 15, 1909.
Walter L. Bogert.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718189f-a.folder: Central Park & [View in the park showing the roof of Arsenal Building.], Manhattan, NY

718225f-a.text:

building outline on Central Park South (WWest 59th Street).
About 1910.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718225f-a.folder: Central Park & The Green., Manhattan, NY

718390f-a.text:
(1)
Central Park : Sailboat Pool, with the Park and Fifth Avenu
houses around 80th Street in the background.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, another view; showing the large model and a tiny
sailboat on their way towards the western edge of he po
where they will meet. (See the last of this series, the
showing no Fifth Avenue houses at all).
May 17, 1933.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same from the southern edge. This pool is also know
Conservatory Lake.
May 2, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

showing one of tne few remaining jehu's who haunt this vicinity.
Fifth Avenue is across the background and the eduestrian statue of

June 1938

718326f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Playgrounds [between North Meadow and Upper Reservoir.]
718326f-a.text:
Central Park: Playgrounds, in the North Meadow, and tennis courts
between the North Meeadow and the Upper Reservoir. The view is
northeast towards upper Fifth Avenue. The driveway in the fore-
ground is the West Drive. A gate house on the northern side of
the Upper Reservoir may be seen at the extreme right.
May 10, 1931.
Varts Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

718215f-a.text:

718190f-d.title: Manhattan: Central Park - [View of the Arsenal Building.]
718190f-d.text:
Central Park: A set of 4 views of the Arsenal under reconstruction,
photographed in a northeastward direction from in the Park, showing the
Mrear of same with the menagerie to the south (frame structures on the
right). Across the background are buildings on the east side of Fifth
Ave. at about 64th Street. The corner stone of this structure was laid
on July 4, 1847. Later it became the headquarters of the Park Police;
who still occupy same today (1938).
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
718190f-d.folder: Central Park & [View of the Arsenal Building.], Manhattan, NY

718398f-a.text:
Central Park : The Sailboat Pool, near Fifth Avenue and 75th Street,
the westen edge of the pool; the view is north.
Two models of racing yachts, a big one and a small one, have crossed
the pool from different directions and are coming together at the
finish. Their owners are waiting fon them.
May 17, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

718199f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Casino.
718199f-a.text:

Mayor LaGuardia and Park Commissioner Moses plan to return all public
parks to the general public. During Mayor Walkers incumbency this
structure was leased to a private restaurant corporation which through
its extreme prices created an exclusive atmosphere.
May 12, 1936.

Avenue in the foreground. In the upper left hand corner Centra
Park West runs off the picture about 69th Street; and in the
upper right harno corner may be seen the southern end of the Mal
The old sheepfold, between the West Drive and the dGth Street g
will be rebuilt in 1934 as an outdoor restaurant, The Tavern on

718180f-a.text:
entral Park: Aerial View from Hotel Sherry-Netherland at the s
mastern corner of the Park, showing the old Arsenal and the 2
which is to be rebuilt in 1934, in the right foreground. To
left mey be seen the Green, or south meadow, and behind it Ce
Park West at 72nd Street. The Mall is in the center of the p
just south of the Lake.
On the east side, at Fifth Avenue and 80th Street, are the buil
of the Letropolitan Museum of Art, and to the left of them th
Lower Keservoir, rectangular in shape, which at the time of t
picture is shortly to go into disuse, with the view of later
it into a garden. The North Reservoir is the large body of w
above it.
Central Park West, from 72nd to 96th Streets, is shown at the 1
Summer, 1930.

718179f-c.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Aerial view from Radio City.
718179f-c.text:
(1)
Central Park: Aerial View from Radio City (Sixth Avenue and 51st
Street), showing the Park and the Fifth Avenue side. In the
center foreground may be seen the Pond, north of it tho l(all,
then the Lake, of which the eastern bay is at thc northern
end of the Mall and the main body on the west side of the
Park, about 70th to 80th Streets. The bare spot further north
is the site of the old reservoir; above it may be seen the nor
reservoir, still in use. The buildings of the Metropolitan
Museum of Art may be seen on the Fifth Avenue side at 81st
Street.
August 9, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, another view. In the southwestern quarter of the
Park may bo seen a ball ground, and north of it the Meadow or
Green. The 72nd Street cross drive separates the Green and
the Lake.
August 9, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718179f-c.folder: Central Park & Aerial view from Radio City., Manhattan, NY

(2)
The same, another view. In the southwestern quarter of the
Park may bo seen a ball ground, and north of it the Meadow or
Green. The 72nd Street cross drive separates the Green and
the Lake.
August 9, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718179f-b.folder: Central Park & Aerial view from Radio City., Manhattan, NY

718179f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Aerial view from Radio City.
718179f-a.text:
(1)
Central Park: Aerial View from Radio City (Sixth Avenue and 51st
Street), showing the Park and the Fifth Avenue side. In the
center foreground may be seen the Pond, north of it tho l(all,
then the Lake, of which the eastern bay is at thc northern
end of the Mall and the main body on the west side of the
Park, about 70th to 80th Streets. The bare spot further north
is the site of the old reservoir; above it may be seen the nor
reservoir, still in use. The buildings of the Metropolitan
Museum of Art may be seen on the Fifth Avenue side at 81st
Street.
August 9, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, another view. In the southwestern quarter of the
Park may bo seen a ball ground, and north of it the Meadow or
Green. The 72nd Street cross drive separates the Green and
the Lake.
August 9, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718179f-a.folder: Central Park & Aerial view from Radio City., Manhattan, NY

718191f-d.title: Manhattan: Central Park - [View of the Arsenal Building.]
718191f-d.text:
Central Park: A set of 5 views of the Arsenal under reconstruction
as viewed westward (north and southward) from Fifth Ave. (foreground)
at East 64th Street. This structure was erected in 1848 at a cost of
30,000 (as given in 1853). The City of New York purchased same in
1856 from the State for a sum of ~275,000. The first floor was used for
Administrative offices while the 2nd and 3rd were occupied by the Museum,
which later became the American Museum of Natural History. The
Meteorological Observatory for years ocoupied a large upper room.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
718191f-d.folder: Central Park & [View of the Arsenal Building.], Manhattan, NY

718181f.title: Manhattan: Central Park - [General view] from Rockefeller Center, Radio City.
718181f.text:
Central Park, as seen from Rockefeller Center, (Radio City). Also
shown is a general view of midtown Manhattan between the Hudson (left)
and East (right) Rivers. Silhouetted against the Park is the West 59th
skyline, consisting of the Essex House, Barbizon Plaza, N. Y. Athletic
Club and the Plasa Hotel buildings.
About 1934.
Rockefeller Center
Hamilton Wright
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718181f.folder: Central Park & [General view] from Rockefeller Center, Radio City., Manhattan, NY

718317f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - Pathways [near the Mall].
718317f-a.text:
(1)
Central Park: Pathway near the Mall; the view is southwest. The
tall building on the horison is the Gotham National Bank Building.
which will later come into the possession of The Manufacturers'
Trust Company; it is located on 59th Street iust west of Columbus
Circle.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2 \& 3)
Two additional views eastward in the same locality to show a Fifth
Ave. apartment house through the trees.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

718394f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park - [Wading pool.]
718394f-a.text:
Central Park.
''The Hotter It Is the Better Ihey Like It''' Let that old
thermometer roar. Ihese youngsters didn't care. They had
one glorious time of it in wading pool at Central Park
yesterday.
''P E A Photw''
From Review of Reviews Corp.
